key_elements: Foreign key relationships with CASCADE/SET NULL delete strategies
JSONB columns for flexible data storage

patterns_discovered.description: Uses postgresql.UUID(as_uuid=True) for primary keys, indicating a well-structured relational database design
CASCADE delete on critical relationships ensures data consistency when parent records are deleted

patterns_discovered.pattern: Soft Delete Pattern via Foreign Key
patterns_discovered.description: Uses SET NULL instead of CASCADE for optional relationships, preserving historical data when referenced records are deleted
Leverages PostgreSQL JSONB for flexible, queryable semi-structured data without schema rigidity
Consistent timestamp tracking with server-side defaults for data provenance

gotchas_discovered.description: InspectionFinding table references project_inspections table which must exist first. The migration correctly creates project_inspections before inspection_findings.
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Order of op.create_table calls is correct

gotchas_discovered.description: In the downgrade function, inspection_findings must be dropped before project_inspections due to the foreign key constraint. Migration correctly drops in reverse order.
stage_template_id column is defined but has no foreign key constraint defined, unlike other relationship columns. This is either intentional or a missed constraint.
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Design decision - could indicate future extensibility or missing constraint

gotchas_discovered.description: Status column has default='not_scheduled' but nullable is not specified (defaults to True). This could allow NULL status values despite having a default.
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Consider explicitly setting nullable=False for status column

approach_outcome.summary: Successfully generated a well-structured Alembic migration that creates two related database tables with appropriate constraints, relationships, and data type choices.
strengths: Proper Alembic migration structure with revision tracking
Correct use of PostgreSQL-specific types (UUID, JSONB)
Thoughtful foreign key constraint design with appropriate delete strategies
Comprehensive column definitions matching the domain model
approach_outcome.completeness: Complete - both tables created with all necessary columns and relationships

recommendations.suggestion: Add NOT NULL constraint to status column to enforce data consistency
recommendations.rationale: Status should never be null; the default value suggests it's a required field

recommendations.suggestion: Add foreign key constraint for stage_template_id with appropriate ondelete strategy
recommendations.rationale: Clarifies whether this is a missing constraint or intentionally left flexible

recommendations.suggestion: Consider adding database indexes on frequently queried foreign key columns
recommendations.rationale: Typical queries will likely filter by project_id, inspection_id, and inspector_id

recommendations.suggestion: Document JSONB schema structure in code comments or separate schema definitions
recommendations.rationale: Consumers of this data will benefit from knowing the expected structure of findings, documents, photos, and additional_data
